isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - REFRIGERANT SYSTEM SERVICE - CHECKING COMPRESSOR OIL LEVEL

svcproc.title: CHECKING COMPRESSOR OIL LEVEL
svcproc.para: The compressor oil level can be checked by using a specially-constructed dipstick ( Figure 20). When the compressor is mounted in the vertical position, the oil level may be checked from the right or left side ( Figure 3). When mounted in the horizontal position, the fill plug is on the top. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS, for complete lubrication specifications.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Dimensions for Locally Made Dipstick. Made from wire; 3/32" to 5/32" (2 mm to 4 mm) Dia. x 12" (305 mm long)

svcproc.para: Refer to REFRIGERANT OIL, for information on oil for HFC-134A air conditioning systems.
